alert.note: Alert for Appanoose; Clarke; Decatur; Jasper; Lucas; Mahaska; Marion; Monroe; Polk; Poweshiek; Ringgold; Warren; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 12:11AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Polk, Marion, Jasper, Warren, Monroe, Lucas, Poweshiek, Decatur, Wayne, western Mahaska, southeastern Ringgold, western Appanoose and Clarke Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Marshalltown to 6 miles east of Lamoni. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Polk, Marion, Jasper, Warren, Monroe, Lucas, Poweshiek, Decatur, Wayne, western Mahaska, southeastern Ringgold, western Appanoose and Clarke Counties, including the following locations... Pella Municipal Airport, Lacona, Lake Ahquabi State Park, Sandyville, Pleasanton, Honey Creek State Park, Otter Creek County Park, Elkhart, Nine Eagles State Park and Decatur City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 1 and 53, and between mile markers 87 and 91. Interstate 80 between mile markers 137 and 200. Interstate 235 between mile markers 8 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Appanoose; Clarke; Decatur; Jasper; Lucas; Mahaska; Marion; Monroe; Polk; Poweshiek; Ringgold; Warren; Wayne
